SENT.plain: Spontaneous intracranial hypotension (SIH) is a well-defined clinical entity that is frequently misdiagnosed
We are reporting a case of 38 years old male who presented with severe headache and an episode of generalized tonic-clonic seizure
He was managed successfully with an epidural blood patch
Understanding of the characteristics, symptomatology, evaluation, treatment options, and prognosis is discussed
